sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: TJGC Stock Price and Chart — NASDAQ:TJGC
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed overview of TJGC Group Limited (NASDAQ: TJGC) stock performance, key financial metrics, and company information. It includes current stock price, historical performance data, market capitalization, revenue, net income, and employee count. Additionally, it offers technical analysis indicators and answers frequently asked questions about the company's stock.

feed.title: SSTK Financials: Income Statement, Balance Sheet & Cash Flow
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed financial analysis of Shutterstock Inc. (SSTK), including its income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow statement up to fiscal year 2025. It highlights key financial health signals such as profitability (moderate operating margin), growth (solid revenue increase), leverage (low debt-to-equity), liquidity (tight current ratio), cash flow (moderate margin), and returns (moderate ROE). The analysis also includes metrics like Altman Z-Score, Piotroski F-Score, and earnings quality, offering a comprehensive overview of the company's financial performance and risks.

feed.title: Swvl Holdings (Nasdaq:SWVL) - Stock Analysis
feed.summary: This article provides a stock analysis of Swvl Holdings (Nasdaq:SWVL), a technology-driven disruptive mobility company. It covers the company's financial performance, recent news and updates, shareholder returns, and key fundamentals such as market cap, earnings, and revenue. The analysis highlights the company's volatile share price and underperformance compared to the US transportation industry and market.

feed.title: SRG - Seritage Growth Pptys Latest Stock News & Market Updates
feed.summary: This page provides investors and traders with the latest news and insights on Seritage Growth Properties (SRG) stock, a real estate company focused on redeveloping retail and mixed-use properties. The news feed covers the company's Plan of Sale, asset sales, leasing milestones, and financial results, including net loss, operating income, and capital structure management. It highlights how these activities impact their Class A common shares and 7.00% Series A cumulative redeemable preferred shares.

feed.title: SPD Stock Fund Price and Chart — AMEX:SPD
feed.summary: The Simplify US Equity PLUS Downside Convexity ETF (SPD) is an actively managed fund that aims for capital appreciation by investing primarily in S&P 500 ETFs with a modest put option overlay. This strategy is designed to offer downside protection without capping upside potential, achieving downside convexity. The fund, launched on September 3, 2020, has assets under management of $114.78 million and an expense ratio of 0.53%.

feed.title: MAX S&P 500 4x Leveraged ETN (XXXX) Chart and Price History 2026 $XXXX
feed.summary: This article provides the chart and price history for the MAX S&P 500 4x Leveraged ETN (XXXX) for 2026. It details the fund's performance over various timeframes, showing a significant decrease in price across the last 12 months, year-to-date, and in the past month. The report also includes daily price, volume, and market capitalization data up to February 27, 2026.

feed.title: Is Strong 2025 Earnings and a Completed Buyback Altering The Investment Case For Vulcan Materials (VMC)?
feed.summary: Vulcan Materials Company (VMC) recently announced strong full-year 2025 results, with substantial sales and net income, coupled with the completion of a significant share buyback program. While these results reinforce management's focus on shareholder returns and capital efficiency, the core investment case for VMC remains tied to the pace of US infrastructure spending and the risks associated with weather volatility and project delays. The article suggests exploring further analysis to understand how these factors influence Vulcan's future outlook and fair value.

feed.title: Is Textron’s New Shelf Filing and 2026 Guidance Altering The Investment Case For Textron (TXT)?
feed.summary: Textron recently announced a quarterly dividend and an omnibus shelf registration, alongside new 2026 guidance. This article examines how these updates, including 2026 revenue and earnings forecasts of about US$15.5 billion and US$6.40 to US$6.60 per share, impact Textron's investment narrative and risk-reward profile, especially concerning its financial flexibility and capital allocation priorities. It also highlights that some analysts had more cautious revenue growth projections, leading to differing conclusions about future opportunities and risks for the company.

feed.title: Royal Caribbean Expands Caribbean Routes And Premium Antarctica Offerings For Investors
feed.summary: Royal Caribbean (NYSE:RCL) has expanded its Caribbean itineraries for 2027-2028 and launched new private destinations, while its Silversea brand opened a bespoke hotel in Chile to support its Antarctica Fly Cruise program. These moves reflect a broader industry trend towards curated experiences and premium adventure travel. Investors should monitor how these new offerings impact guest reception, the allocation of capital between mass market and premium segments, and the company's high debt level in funding these developments.

feed.title: Mosaic (MOS) Is Down 5.4% After Q4 Loss Highlights Profit Squeeze Amid Cost-Cutting Pivot
feed.summary: The Mosaic Company (MOS) reported a net loss of US$519.5 million and diluted loss per share of US$1.64 in Q4 2025, leading to a 5.4% stock price drop. The loss was attributed to weaker U.S. phosphate demand and delayed government support, despite increased full-year sales and ongoing cost-cutting efforts. Management plans further cost reductions and higher phosphate and potash production in 2026 to improve margins and balance sheet strength.

feed.title: Sociedad Quimica y Minera S.A. (NYSE:SQM) Receives Average Rating of "Moderate Buy" from Brokerages
feed.summary: Sociedad Quimica y Minera S.A. (NYSE:SQM) has received an average rating of "Moderate Buy" from fourteen brokerages, with an average 12-month price target of $69.7917. Several analysts have recently updated their ratings and price targets, including upgrades from Scotiabank and Zacks Research, and an increase in price target from JPMorgan Chase & Co. The company also recently announced a special dividend.

feed.title: Tarsus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TARS) Downgraded to Hold Rating by Wall Street Zen
feed.summary: Wall Street Zen downgraded Tarsus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:TARS) from "buy" to "hold," contributing to a mixed analyst outlook despite a consensus "Moderate Buy" rating with an $87 target. The company's Q4 revenue of $151.7 million exceeded estimates, but EPS slightly missed, and it remains unprofitable with negative margins. Insider stock sales and significant institutional ownership were also noted.

feed.title: Talkspace (NASDAQ:TALK) Upgraded by Wall Street Zen to "Strong-Buy" Rating
feed.summary: Wall Street Zen has upgraded Talkspace (NASDAQ:TALK) to a "strong-buy" rating, despite mixed analyst sentiment that averages to a "Moderate Buy" with a $5.13 price target. The company recently surpassed earnings and revenue expectations, reporting $0.03 EPS and $63.0M in revenue, and has a market cap of approximately $798 million. Institutional ownership is high at 57%, with several major funds increasing their stakes in the fourth quarter.

feed.title: Supernus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SUPN) Stock Rating Upgraded by Wall Street Zen
feed.summary: Wall Street Zen has upgraded Supernus Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SUPN) from a "buy" to a "strong-buy" rating, though other analysts have mixed opinions, resulting in a consensus "Hold" rating with a $62.17 price target. The company's stock currently trades around $54.73, with recent insider selling activity observed. Supernus Pharmaceuticals specializes in developing and commercializing central nervous system therapies.

feed.title: Smith & Wesson Brands (NASDAQ:SWBI) Rating Lowered to Hold at Wall Street Zen
feed.summary: Wall Street Zen has downgraded Smith & Wesson Brands (NASDAQ:SWBI) from "buy" to "hold", maintaining a consensus "Hold" rating with an average price target of $11.00. The company recently surpassed earnings and revenue estimates but experienced a 3.9% year-over-year revenue decline and has thin net margins. Shares are currently trading around $11.90, with institutional investors holding approximately 59% of the stock.

feed.title: TFS Financial Governance Continuity Puts Dividend Sustainability In The Spotlight
feed.summary: Shareholders of TFS Financial re-elected directors and approved executive compensation, signaling comfort with current leadership. While this indicates stable governance, questions arise regarding the sustainability of the 8.06% dividend yield given its current coverage by earnings and recent insider selling. TFS Financial's stock has seen positive returns over the past year and three years, and earnings are forecast to grow, potentially supporting future dividend coverage.

feed.title: Hormel Refocuses On Value Added Protein As CTO Leads Tech Shift
feed.summary: Hormel Foods (NYSE:HRL) is divesting its whole bird turkey business to concentrate on higher-margin, value-added protein products, reflecting a strategic shift away from commodity-driven categories. The company has also appointed Donald Monk as its first Chief Technology Officer to spearhead its technology and data strategy, signaling a move towards integrating data, automation, and digital tools into its core operations. These actions aim to reshape Hormel's portfolio and internal capabilities for long-term margin improvement, operational efficiency, and a more resilient earnings profile.

feed.title: Is It Too Late To Consider Equinix (EQIX) After Its Strong Share Price Momentum?
feed.summary: Equinix (EQIX) has shown strong share price momentum recently. A Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggests it is undervalued by 30.7% at its current price of US$974, estimating an intrinsic value of $1,406 per share. However, its current P/E ratio of 70.91x is higher than the industry average and a "Fair Ratio" of 37.88x, indicating it is overvalued by this metric.

feed.title: Duke Energy Stock After Earnings: Safe Utility Or Rate-Cut Winner In Disguise?
feed.summary: Duke Energy updated Wall Street on its earnings, grid spending, and dividend path, positioning itself as a potential defensive yield in a volatile market. The stock's performance in the next year will largely depend on interest rate cuts, capital spending discipline, and the sustainability of its dividend. While analysts view DUK as a "bond proxy" with moderate upside, its predictable cash flows and regulated nature make it suitable for income-focused or risk-averse investors, especially if the Federal Reserve eases rates.

feed.title: ICE Stock Surges 6.6% With A 5-day Winning Spree On Record Earnings Beat
feed.summary: ICE stock surged 6.6% and recorded a five-day winning streak following an earnings beat. The article indicates this positive performance is due to strong financial results.

feed.title: GPN Stock Falls -7.3% With A 5-day Losing Spree On Post-Earnings Doubts
feed.summary: GPN stock experienced a significant drop of 7.3%, extending a five-day losing streak due to skepticism following its latest earnings report. The article title highlights investor doubts regarding the company's recent financial performance.

feed.title: NextEra’s Quiet Energy Shift: What US Customers Should Watch Now
feed.summary: NextEra Energy is silently transforming into a service-first clean energy provider in the US, impacting how customers buy power, use solar, charge EVs, and invest in green energy. The company is packaging long-term energy services, often through existing utility brands, to offer predictable pricing, lower carbon footprints, and improved home resilience. This strategic shift is driven by US demand and policy, with NextEra moving from building single assets to selling comprehensive service packages that include generation, storage, and grid services.

feed.title: TIPT Earning Date, Earning Analysis and Earning Prediction
feed.summary: This article provides an earnings analysis and prediction for TIPT, including past and future earning dates, revenue and EPS estimates, and AI predictions. It examines historical stock price reactions around earnings reports and offers insights into potential trading strategies. The article also includes a positive sentiment analysis for Tiptree Inc. (TIPT)'s Q3 2024 earnings call.

feed.title: SP Funds Dow Jones Global Sukuk ETF (NYSE: SPSK) - Dividends
feed.summary: This article provides a detailed list of past and upcoming dividend distributions for the SP Funds Dow Jones Global Sukuk ETF (NYSE: SPSK). It includes information such as distribution type, dividend franking percentage, ex-dividend date, payment date, current price, and 7-day average price for each dividend. The current trading price for SPSK is $18.345.

feed.title: STOK PE Ratio & Valuation, Is STOK Overvalued
feed.summary: Stoke Therapeutics Inc (STOK) is currently considered overvalued, with its forward P/S ratio of 99.55 significantly higher than its five-year average. According to relative valuation methods, STOK's fair price ranges from $5.77 to $21.27, making its current price of $35.71 about 67.9% overvalued. Despite this, its robust revenue growth of 117.25% might sustain the premium compared to its competitors' average P/S ratio of 22.39.

feed.title: Schwab International Small-Cap Equity ETF Review and Aggregate Rating (SCHC)
feed.summary: This article provides a review and aggregate rating for the Schwab International Small-Cap Equity ETF (SCHC). Based on analyst ratings for its holdings, SCHC currently has an aggregate "Buy" rating with an average consensus price target of $51.54. The ratings are derived from Wall Street analysts' assessments of the ETF's underlying companies, with Equinox Gold being a significant holding contributing to the overall rating.

feed.title: Wynn Resorts (WYNN) Posts Steady Q4 Results as UAE Project Advances
feed.summary: Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ: WYNN) reported steady operational results for Q4 2025, with adjusted property EBITDAR of $569 million despite missing earnings estimates. The company's Wynn Las Vegas and Macau operations showed strong performance, contributing $241 million and $271 million in Q4 EBITDAR, respectively. A key strategic project is the construction of Wynn Al Marjan Island in the UAE, which is progressing well and expected to open in Q1 2027, having reached a construction milestone in December 2025 with the hotel tower topping out.

feed.title: PHM Earning Date, Earning Analysis and Earning Prediction
feed.summary: This article provides an in-depth analysis of PHM's past earnings reports, future earnings forecasts, and expected stock price reactions. It highlights recent revenue and EPS figures, analyst estimates for 2026/Q1, and the correlation between earnings revisions and stock performance. The article also includes a summary of the Q4 2025 earnings call, indicating a neutral sentiment with balanced positives and negatives for Pultegroup Inc.

feed.title: Honeywell Portfolio Shake Up And Catalyst Deal Repricing Test Valuation
feed.summary: Honeywell International is undergoing a significant portfolio reshaping, including planned asset sales, a spinoff of its aerospace and automation businesses, and an amended acquisition deal for Johnson Matthey's Catalyst Technologies. These strategic moves are expected to alter Honeywell's revenue mix and competitive position, with institutional investors already initiating new positions based on the anticipated impact. The company's shares are currently trading below analyst targets but above Simply Wall St's fair value estimate, indicating a rich valuation despite strong recent momentum.

feed.title: Pool Corp (POOL) Margin Drift Challenges Bullish Earnings Narrative After FY 2025 Results
feed.summary: Pool Corp (POOL) closed FY 2025 with Q4 revenue of US$982.2 million and EPS of US$0.86, showing annual revenue of US$5.3 billion and EPS of US$10.89. Despite solid earnings, the company experienced a drift in net profit margins from 8.1% to 7.6% over the trailing twelve months, which challenges the bullish narrative, especially given a five-year earnings decline. Analysts forecast modest growth, with the large existing pool infrastructure and recurring maintenance providing some support against margin compression and slower growth compared to broader market averages.

feed.title: Pfizer’s New mCRC Standard Of Care And What It Means For Valuation
feed.summary: Pfizer received full FDA approval for BRAFTOVI in combination with cetuximab and fluorouracil-based chemotherapy for BRAF V600E mutant metastatic colorectal cancer, establishing it as a new first-line standard of care. This approval expands Pfizer's oncology portfolio and is a clinically relevant asset for investors. The article notes Pfizer's stock currently trades below analyst targets but is considered undervalued by Simply Wall St's valuation model, while also flagging a potential risk regarding dividend coverage.

feed.title: Booking Holdings Split And OpenTable Media Shift Growth Story
feed.summary: Booking Holdings announced a 25-for-1 stock split to increase accessibility for investors and introduced a new media solution via OpenTable to generate new ad revenue. These strategic moves aim to diversify Booking's revenue streams, attract a broader retail investor base, and leverage its existing restaurant network for advertising opportunities, expanding beyond its core booking commissions. Investors are advised to monitor how these changes impact trading activity, OpenTable Media adoption, and the company's financial performance.

feed.title: Wynn Resorts (WYNN) Posts Steady Q4 Results as UAE Project Advances
feed.summary: Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ: WYNN) reported steady fourth-quarter 2025 results, with an adjusted property EBITDAR of $569 million, despite missing earnings estimates. The company's Wynn Las Vegas and Macau operations showed strong performance, and construction on the Wynn Al Marjan Island in the UAE is progressing, with an expected opening in Q1 2027. This project is a key strategic focus for the luxury hotel and casino operator.

feed.title: ConocoPhillips Permian Sale Review Highlights Portfolio High Grading And Cash Goals
feed.summary: ConocoPhillips is considering selling some Permian Basin assets for an estimated US$2 billion to streamline its portfolio and meet a US$5 billion divestiture goal by 2026. This move aligns with a strategy of high-grading assets, refocusing capital on higher-priority projects like Willow and LNG developments, especially after recent earnings missed expectations. Investors will be watching how this sale impacts future spending, capital allocation plans, and the company's long-term growth narrative in US shale versus larger, longer-lived projects.

feed.title: Bank Of New York Mellon Capital Move Tests Valuation And Dividend Appeal
feed.summary: Bank of New York Mellon Corporation (NYSE:BK) recently completed a $500 million preferred stock offering, with potential plans to redeem outstanding Series F and possibly Series H Preferred Stock. This move occurs while the company's shares have seen substantial appreciation, returning 36.4% over the past year and 151.5% over 3 years. Investors are now watching how this capital reshuffle will affect BNY's funding mix, cost of capital, and its impact on common share valuation and dividend sustainability.

feed.title: Procter And Gamble’s USA Gymnastics Return And What It Means For Investors
feed.summary: Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) has re-signed as a top-level sponsor for USA Gymnastics for the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics, marking the first partner to return since recent scandals. This sponsorship aims to enhance P&G's brand presence and consumer engagement around the home Olympics, reinforcing long-term brand strength and customer loyalty. For investors, while it represents a move towards brand building rather than immediate sales, it also indicates a perceived rehabilitation of USA Gymnastics and could support P&G's earnings growth, though potential reputational risks and marketing costs should be considered.

feed.title: Blackstone CEO Schwarzman Earns Over $1.2 Billion In 2025 Amid Record Profits
feed.summary: Blackstone CEO Stephen Schwarzman earned over $1.2 billion in 2025, driven by the alternative asset manager's record profits. This figure, slightly below his 2022 record, includes $1.1 billion in dividends and $125.6 million from carried interest and incentive fees. President Jon Gray also saw significant earnings and forecasted 2026 as "the year of the IPO."

feed.title: Is It Too Late To Consider Cboe Global Markets (CBOE) After Its Strong Multi‑Year Rally?
feed.summary: Cboe Global Markets (CBOE) has seen a significant multi-year rally, but two valuation approaches suggest the stock may now be overvalued. Simply Wall St's Excess Returns model indicates CBOE is 13.8% overvalued, while its P/E ratio is considerably higher than its proprietary "Fair Ratio," further suggesting overvaluation based on earnings. The article advises investors to explore different valuation narratives to align with their assumptions.

feed.title: Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) Gets Price Target Increase to $32 from Barclays
feed.summary: Barclays has increased its price target for Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) to $32 from $30, maintaining an Equal Weight rating. CEO Timothy Cofer highlighted 2025 as a strong year with solid results, achievement of full-year guidance, and significant retail sales growth driven by innovation and strong execution. The company is also preparing for the acquisition of JDE Peet’s and future separation into two focused businesses, with priorities for 2026 including double-digit EPS growth and integration of the acquisition.

feed.title: Chipotle opens in Harpersfield Township
feed.summary: A new Chipotle Mexican Restaurant has opened in Harpersfield Township, drawing customers and long lines to its drive-thru shortly after its 10:45 a.m. opening. Located at 1800 South Broadway, the restaurant is leasing land from SPIRE Academy, whose Chief Executive Officer Steve Sanders expressed excitement about the new addition to the Route 45 corridor and anticipates more restaurants will open in the area. The restaurant offers a curated menu with high-protein options, including the Double High Protein Bowl and High Protein-High Fiber Bowl.

feed.title: Realty Income Broadens Portfolio As Valuation Screens Undervalued For Investors
feed.summary: Realty Income (NYSE:O) is diversifying its portfolio beyond retail properties, venturing into industrial assets in Mexico, casinos, and data centers through a new Core Plus Fund and a joint venture with GIC. While maintaining its strong dividend focus, these strategic moves aim to broaden income sources and reduce tenant concentration risk. The company's shares are currently trading below Simply Wall St's fair value estimate, despite being slightly above analyst targets.

feed.title: Ulta Beauty Weighs Global Growth Inclusivity And AI Against Premium Valuation
feed.summary: Ulta Beauty is pursuing a multifaceted growth strategy under its new CEO, Kecia Steelman, focusing on global expansion, inclusivity initiatives like the MUSE Accelerator program for women and BIPOC-owned brands, and AI-driven personalization. While the stock has seen significant returns over the past year and five years, it trades above its estimated fair value. Investors are advised to monitor revenue, earnings, MUSE program traction, and AI's impact on customer engagement, especially given the company's premium valuation and potential execution risks.

feed.title: S&P Global Uses CERAWeek To Deepen Role In Energy Transition
authors: Simply Wall St Reviewed by Bailey Pemberton
feed.summary: S&P Global is hosting the 44th annual CERAWeek conference to reinforce its position as a central source for energy information and policy discussions. The event brings together key stakeholders to discuss energy transition, geopolitics, and new technologies, highlighting S&P Global's capabilities in data, analytics, and consulting. For investors, CERAWeek offers insights into long-term energy themes and helps solidify S&P Global's growth narrative around energy transition and climate products.

feed.title: Tivic Health partners with Scorpius for drug manufacturing
feed.summary: Tivic Health Systems Inc. has finalized an agreement with Scorpius BioManufacturing for the GMP manufacturing validation of Entolimod™, its primary drug candidate for Acute Radiation Syndrome. This partnership values the program at approximately $4.1 million and is a crucial step towards the drug's Biological Licensing Application to the FDA. Scorpius Holdings, meanwhile, faces challenges including a NYSE American delisting notification but anticipates significant sales growth this year, with a projected revenue increase of 156%.

feed.title: Sanofi and Regeneron’s Dupixent recommended for EU approval to treat chronic spontaneous urticaria in young children with ongoing symptoms despite treatment
feed.summary: Sanofi and Regeneron's Dupixent has received a positive opinion from the European Medicines Agency's CHMP for the treatment of moderate-to-severe chronic spontaneous urticaria (CSU) in children aged two to 11 years. If approved, Dupixent would be the first targeted therapy for this age group in the EU whose symptoms are inadequately controlled by standard antihistamine treatments. This recommendation is supported by data from the LIBERTY-CUPID clinical study program.

feed.title: TransAlta signs Alberta data centre deal with CPP Investments and Brookfield
feed.summary: TransAlta Corp. has partnered with the Canada Pension Plan Investment Board and Brookfield to power a new data centre near Edmonton, aligning with Alberta's goal to expand its data centre industry. The agreement involves providing an initial 230 megawatts of power, potentially increasing to 1,000 megawatts, from TransAlta's retooled Keephills power plant. Additionally, TransAlta reported its fourth-quarter financial results, including a loss and a raised quarterly dividend, while also providing an update on its Centralia power plant conversion in Washington State.

feed.title: Royal Caribbean Kreuzfahrt: What US Travelers Should Know Now
feed.summary: This article provides a comprehensive overview for US travelers considering a Royal Caribbean cruise, or "Kreuzfahrt." It highlights the current trends of larger ships, advanced onboard technology, and short, impactful getaways, emphasizing that Royal Caribbean is aggressively targeting the US market with family-friendly experiences and resort-level amenities. The piece also discusses pricing, potential hidden costs, and the importance of early booking while noting both the strengths (entertainment, private islands) and weaknesses (crowds, upselling) of the Royal Caribbean experience.

feed.title: ConocoPhillips (COP) Stock Gains UBS Confidence as Willow Project Advances
feed.summary: UBS has increased its price target for ConocoPhillips (NYSE:COP) to $130, maintaining a Buy rating, despite recent quarterly earnings missing expectations. The firm's confidence is partly due to the progress of COP's Willow project, which is expected to be halfway complete this construction season and could significantly expand resource development. UBS also sees ConocoPhillips as the best-positioned company to extract value from Venezuela, given its existing claims and potential production in the region.

feed.title: HANMI FINANCIAL CORP SEC 10-K Report
feed.summary: Hanmi Financial Corporation has released its 2024 Form 10-K report, providing a detailed overview of its financial performance, business operations, and strategic initiatives. The report indicates a decrease in net income and earnings per diluted share compared to the previous year, primarily due to reduced net interest income and increased noninterest expenses. Despite these challenges, the company actively manages interest rate risk, maintains a strong capital position exceeding regulatory requirements, and focuses on community engagement and diversity in its workforce.

feed.title: Barclays Cuts KKR & Co. (KKR) Price Target Amid Mixed Q4 Results, Maintains Overweight Rating
feed.summary: Barclays has reduced its price target for KKR & Co. Inc. to $136 from $159 following mixed Q4 earnings, though it maintains an Overweight rating. While KKR's adjusted net income per share missed analyst forecasts, revenue significantly outperformed expectations. The company also raised $28 billion in funds and reaffirmed its EPS forecast for fiscal year 2026, largely dependent on increased realizations.
